AAE.caption: To email(s)
AAE.doc: Recipient(s) of the email. separate emails by a comma, e.g. plugins@airdev.co,plugins+1@airdev.co
AAE.name: to

AAF.caption: From email
AAF.doc: Email from which this will be sent. Ensure that this user is a Verified Sender in SendGrid (unless your SendGrid account is from before April 2020).
AAF.name: fromEmail

AAG.caption: CC email(s)
AAG.doc: separate emails by a comma, e.g. plugins@airdev.co,plugins+1@airdev.co
AAG.name: cc

AAH.caption: BCC email(s)
AAH.doc: separate emails by a comma, e.g. plugins@airdev.co,plugins+1@airdev.co
AAH.name: bcc

AAR.caption: Body
AAR.default_val: This is just a test email.
AAR.doc: The main text body of the email.
AAR.name: body

AAU.caption: Signature
AAU.doc: Text sent at the end of the email. This field can be HTML if you want to create an HTML signature.
AAU.name: signature

AAW.caption: Include Button
AAW.doc: Include a button with the email
AAW.name: button

AAX.caption: Attachment(s)
AAX.doc: Files to be attached to the email
AAX.name: attachments

AAo.caption: From name
AAo.doc: Name of the sender displayed to the receiver in their inbox
AAo.name: fromName

AAp.caption: Reply to name
AAp.doc: Name of the reply-to email displayed to the receiver
AAp.name: replyToName

AAr.caption: Mail Merge
AAr.doc: Fields to be replaced in the following fields: signature, subject, button text, body, from name, reply to name
AAr.name: mailMerge

ABo.caption: Extra parameters
ABo.doc: Enter custom JSON to show other parameters in these fields. Check the SendGrid V3 Send API endpoint documentation for possible parameters to send,                 Example JSON: {"categories": ["marketing", "campaign", "2021"],    "tracking_settings": {     "click_tracking": {       "enable": true,       "enable_text": false     },     "open_tracking": {       "enable": true,       "substitution_tag": "%open-track%"     },     "subscription_tracking": {       "enable": false     }   }  }
ABo.name: extra_parameters

ABs.caption: Throw a Bubble error when the email is not sent, or some other error happens on the SendGrid side. This will stop the rest of the workflow from executing.
ABs.name: info

ABu.caption: When unhandled errors are NOT thrown, the workflow keeps executing and no error message is shown in the Server logs. Instead, the error message is exposed as a result of this plugin action, and you can set up appropriate error handling logic in the subsequent workflow actions.
ABu.name: info2
